function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Lack of insurance coverage for the pandemic","category":"Land Use","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of comprehensive pandemic-related considerations in the paper","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Construction site suspensions and slow progress hindering data collection","category":"Settlement","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of implementing unvalidated best practices in construction projects","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Future research work on covid-19 in the construction industry could lead to increased exposure to the virus","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inclusion of additional sensors could lead to increased risk of contamination and spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Wearable sensors may not be practical to wear many different sensors at one time, leading to limited data collection.","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases in academic research centers","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited ventilation and air circulation in research laboratories","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Effects of ergonomics on musculoskeletal disorders in office spaces","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Difficulty in defining quantitative metrics for occupant health in buildings","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Ambiguity in the type of data that should be collected","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Difficulty of linking building-related data to occupant health","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of comprehensive measurement of economic value of health in buildings","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Neglect of healthy building performance during extreme events","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of optimal layouts for physical distancing","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for occupant health in building design","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited emphasis on designing, constructing, and operating buildings with occupant health and well-being as an objective","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Data-related challenges for achieving design and operation of healthy buildings.","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Airborne transmission of viruses in indoor environments","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Surface-touch contamination as a mode of virus transmission","category":"Soil","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Greater attention to ventilation systems to maintain high indoor air quality and limit infection in indoor spaces.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of focus on mental health in building occupant studies","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of * for experimental/laboratory studies without specifying the building type","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of flexibility in building design to adapt to changes without compromising occupant well-being","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Global epidemics of stress and longer working hours may impact occupant mental and social well-being in buildings.","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased risk of sbs symptoms due to high air temperature exceeding 22°c","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disease outbreaks due to poor water quality and distribution in buildings","category":"Water","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of physical activity opportunities in buildings leading to occupant health issues","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor building design contributing to the spread of contagious diseases through close proximity and shared facilities.","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation and air quality leading to the accumulation of airborne contaminants and pathogens.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of outdoor access and green spaces leading to poor mental and physical health.","category":"Nature","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Commercial off-the-shelf sensors for ieq parameters","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Poor indoor air quality leading to health issues for building occupants","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate thermal comfort causing discomfort and reduced productivity for occupants","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient visual comfort leading to eye strain, fatigue, and reduced cognitive performance for occupants","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exposure to toxic heavy metals in green buildings due to the use of fly ash in construction materials","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Emission of vocs from common products into the indoor environment","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate housing conditions leading to poor indoor air quality","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Degradation of indoor conditions leading to decreased productivity","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased sick leaves and presenteeism due to unhealthy buildings","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Health-related costs due to poor indoor environments","category":"Biodiversity","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inefficient building design leading to airborne transmission of infectious diseases","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation and cooling capacity during extreme events leading to body heat overload and heat-related illnesses.","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Sandstorms leading to degraded air quality, respiratory problems, heart stress, and eye infections.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shift from natural ventilation to active cooling strategies like evaporative cooling","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Hurricanes, tornados, and floods leading to mold growth in buildings","category":"Water","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient ventilation leading to increased infection risk","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Hvac system aiding the spread of sars-cov-2","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low humidity levels allow droplets to become droplet nuclei, remain in the air for prolonged periods of time, and travel for long distances.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"}]}
